title: Paul Nuttall slams 'OVERBLOWN' rise in racist attacks as ploy to 'RUBBISH' Brexit vote
text:
Paul Nuttall slams 'OVERBLOWN' rise in racist attacks as ploy to 'RUBBISH' Brexit vote Paul Nuttall slams 'OVERBLOWN' rise in racist attacks as ploy to 'RUBBISH' Brexit vote PAUL Nuttall has claimed the rise in racist attacks following the Brexit vote has been “overblown” in a desperate bid to “rubbish” the vote to leave the European Union. PUBLISHED: 05:48, Wed, Feb 15, 2017 | UPDATED: 06:16, Wed, Feb 15, 2017 GETTY Paul Nuttall has blasted the rise in racist attacks 
The Ukip leader said many of the hate crimes were “fabricated” and that Ukip were due to release its own paper on the topic. 
Mr Nuttall said: “A lot of that [rise in hate crimes] is fabricated. In fact, we’ve got a paper coming out, specifically focused on London and the hate crime spike. Related articles 
“What the police said is there tends to be a rise in these types of crime after any national event and then it tails off. I’m not sure I buy into [the rise in hate crimes].” 
The North West MEP expressed his sympathy for those who had been victims of hate crimes. 
He told the Independent: “Of course there will be individual instances and people should never be victims of hate crime at all. GETTY The Ukip leader said the rise was being used as a ploy to rubbish Brexit I think a lot of this has been overblown specifically to try to rubbish Brexit Paul Nuttall 
“I’ve said this in the chamber in the European Parliament, my heart goes out to those people who have been victims, but I think a lot of this has been overblown specifically to try to rubbish Brexit.” 
His remarks comes after new data from police forces across England and Wales show a rise in incidents between July and September. 
Record levels of hate crime were reported in 33 of the 44 police forces following the EU referendum. 
The Metropolitan Police, Greater Manchester and West Yorkshire all recorded more than 1,000 hate crimes following the vote to leave the clutches of the bureaucratic Brussels bloc. REMOANERS: These people hate BREXIT! Mon, January 16, 2017
